enabled_request_types.brief_description: Apply for resource consent for activities requiring approval under the Lower Hutt District Plan. Typical processing time is 20 working days for non-notified applications.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
How to Apply

  1. Submit Online: Complete the application form with all required information
  2. Initial Review: We'll acknowledge receipt within 2 working days and assign a planner
  3. RFI (if needed): We may request additional information - the clock stops during this time
  4. Decision: Non-notified applications decided within 20 working days

What You Need

  • Site plans and drawings
  • Assessment of Environmental Effects (AEE)
  • Written approvals from affected parties (if applicable)

Questions?

Contact our planning team: planning@huttcity.govt.nz or call 04 570 6666
enabled_request_types.notes: Assign to planning team. Check for pre-app meetings first.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Apply for building consent for construction, alteration, or demolition work under the Building Act 2004.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Building Consent Process

  1. Submit detailed plans and specifications
  2. Initial assessment within 5 working days
  3. Request for Information (RFI) if required
  4. Consent issued within 20 working days

For complex projects, please contact our building team first.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Request property information including zoning, rates, building consents, and known hazards.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
LIM Turnaround

Standard LIMs are processed within 10 working days. We gather information from multiple council departments to provide you with comprehensive property information.

Includes:

  • Property zoning and district plan information
  • Building and resource consent history
  • Rates and services information
  • Known hazards and restrictions
enabled_request_types.notes: Standard processing - no complex review needed

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Apply to subdivide your property into multiple titles. Required for all subdivisions regardless of number of lots.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Subdivision Process

  1. Pre-application meeting recommended (free)
  2. Submit subdivision application with survey plan
  3. Processing and assessment (up to 30 working days)
  4. Resource consent decision
  5. Survey plan approval (s223 certification)
  6. Title issue via LINZ

Contact our subdivision team to discuss your proposal: subdivisions@huttcity.govt.nz
enabled_request_types.notes: Complex - assign to senior planner. May require infrastructure contributions.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Obtain certification that your proposed activity complies with district plan rules without needing resource consent.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Certificate Process

We will assess your proposal against the district plan rules and provide written confirmation of compliance within 10 working days.

This is useful when you need formal confirmation for property sales or legal purposes.
enabled_request_types.notes: Check zone rules carefully before issuing

enabled_request_types.brief_description: General enquiries, service requests, or complaints about council services.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Service Request

We aim to respond to all service requests within 5 working days. Urgent matters such as blocked drains or fallen trees are prioritized.

You can track your service request online once submitted.
enabled_request_types.notes: Triage and route to appropriate team

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Apply for resource consent under the Wellington District Plan. Higher fees reflect our comprehensive assessment process.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Wellington City Resource Consent Process

Our planning team provides thorough assessment of resource consent applications. We work with heritage, urban design, and transport advisors to ensure quality outcomes.

Timeline

  • Acknowledgement: 2 working days
  • Processing: up to 20 working days (non-notified)
  • Notified applications: up to 130 working days

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Building consent applications for Wellington City. Earthquake-prone building requirements apply.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Building Consent - Wellington

Special attention to seismic requirements and heritage considerations in the central city.
enabled_request_types.notes: Check EPB status for existing buildings

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Property information reports including earthquake-prone building status and heritage listings.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Wellington City LIM

Comprehensive property reports including earthquake risk, heritage status, and CBD overlay information.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Report issues, request services, or make enquiries about Wellington City Council services.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Service Requests

Report issues online 24/7. Track your request from submission to completion.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Resource consent applications for Porirua City. Free pre-application advice available.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Porirua Resource Consents

We encourage early engagement with our planning team. Book a free 30-minute pre-application meeting to discuss your proposal.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Building consent for construction work in Porirua City.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Building Consents

Fast-track available for standard residential builds. Contact our building team to check eligibility.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Land Information Memorandum for properties in Porirua City.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Porirua LIM Service

Quick turnaround for standard LIM requests within 10 working days.

enabled_request_types.brief_description: Subdivision applications for Porirua. Three Waters requirements apply.
enabled_request_types.process_description:
Subdivision - Porirua

All subdivisions require assessment of three waters capacity. Early consultation with infrastructure team recommended.
